A Curious Encounter

A dimly lit tavern, two men face each other.  
Svidrigaïlov smirks slyly.  
Svidrigaïlov: “You’re an interesting subject for observation.”  
Raskolnikov: “What do you want from me?”  
Svidrigaïlov: “Just to hear something new, perhaps.”  

---  

The remnants of a meal sit on a table.  
Svidrigaïlov gestures at the food.  
Svidrigaïlov: “What profit could you make?”  
Raskolnikov: “I don’t even know what you mean.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov expresses his interest in Raskolnikov as a subject of observation due to his connection to a person of interest and the complexity of their interaction.
